bibl.title: Letter from Ronald Ross to Henry Young & Sons, February 7, 1921

div1.p: Ross sends a photograph of himself for Kelly. He provides a journal reference for his work on malaria.

div1.head: Letter from Ronald Ross to Henry Young & Sons, February 7, 1921
div1.opener:
SCIENCE PROGRESS
PUBLISHED BY Ms. MURRAY, 50A ALBEMARLE STREET, LONDON, W.I.
From the Editor
SIR RONALD ROSS, K.C.B., F.R.S., D.Sc.
Telephone: PADDINGTON 3100
36 HARLEY HOUSE,
LONDON, N.W.1.
7th February, 1921.
Messrs. Henry Young & Sons,
12 South Castle Street,
Liverpool.
Dear Sirs,
div1.p:
I must apologies for delay in dealing with the matter
of your letter to me of 1st November last asking me for a portrait
of myself for Dr. Howard A. Kelly of Baltimore. I regret that I
cannot give him a portrait of the time when I was working in
India, as I have only one or two photographs of this period left;
but I send him a very good one of myself taken in Mauritius in 1908
when I was there in order to advise the Government of Mauritius as
to how best to get rid of their malaria. The portrait is duly
signed and will I hope, suit Dr. Kelly. Dr. Kelly's book on Reed
is on my shelves and has always been much liked by myself. If he
wants to see any summary of my work on malaria he will find it in
the January number of Science Progress, in which I give a brief
history of recent malaria work.
I return you Dr. Kelly's letter,
div1.closer:
Believe me,
Yours faithfully, Ronald Ross 2 Encls.
